Package edu.umn.nlpie.mtap.model

Class GenericLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<@NotNull java.lang.String,​@Nullable java.lang.Object>
      • edu.umn.nlpie.mtap.common.AbstractJsonObject
        • edu.umn.nlpie.mtap.model.GenericLabel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JsonObject, Label, java.util.Map<@NotNull java.lang.String,​@Nullable java.lang.Object>
    public class GenericLabel
extends AbstractJsonObject
implements Label
    A generalized, dynamic label on text which can contain arbitrary key-value items.

    A immutable representation of a JSON object, this class provides the basis of generic labels and the parameter and results dictionaries for processing.

    JSON objects do not have references, this means that attempting to add object graphs which contain reference loops will fail. It also means that the entire object graph will be replicated in full, even if the references are shared between different objects. In the case of labels, objects that share references to data prior to serialization will not share those references after deserialization, copies of the data will exist on both objects.

    Valid types for storage in a Json map are

    • Java primitive types
    • Maps of strings to valid types
    • Lists of valid types.

    In Json, all numbers are stored as floating point, so Byte, Short, Integer, Long are all cast to a Double value. Likewise, Float is converted to Double. String and Boolean are stored directly. Character is converted to a String of length 1.

    This class can be subclassed for convenience, for example: 

       
   public class PosTag extends GenericLabel {
     private PosTag(JsonObject jsonObject) {
       super(jsonObject);
     }

     public String getTag() {
       return getStringValue("tag");
     }

     public static PosTag create(int startIndex, int endIndex, String tag) {
       GenericLabel label = GenericLabel.newBuilder(startIndex, endIndex)
           .setProperty("tag", tag)
           .build();
       return new PosTag(label);
     }
   }
